instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Arrived with minor liquid damage on <CHIP>U7941</CHIP> <TRANSISTOR>Q7335</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7330</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q2815</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q2800</TRANSISTOR>. Replaced everything but still have 15V <SIGNAL>ONPPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. Fan spins a couple seconds then stops then continues e.t.c

Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> at the same time but still 15V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

What should be tried next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Probably bad R/<CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> burnt again...

threads.message: they all check out good and traces are good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Pin 17 is directly connected to L7030.
At least should be, through 0+0.01 ohm=10 miliohm in total.
How can you get different DC voltage reading then???

BTW, measure ALWAYS DC voltage on the output pin of a coil from a buck-converter.
